summary: This bill, the Indo-Pacific Treaty Organization Act, directs the President to establish a task force to analyze China and North Korea's behavior in the Indo-Pacific region. The task force will assess whether a collective security agreement between the United States and its allies, including Japan, South Korea, and others, could deter aggression. The Secretary of State will chair the task force, composed of various cabinet members and officials. Within a year, the Secretary of State must report findings and recommendations to relevant congressional committees.
